ose by. I am
also glad to see that this site is not all negative. I had jus=

joined last week, and made the post about the Door to the Dead; and
with =
all the negative post was thinking about leaving this forum. In
fact I had =
e-mailed Larry privately expressing that thought.

I have seen a rash of e-=
mails more up beat so I have gone back to
individual e-mails from the diges=
t. I think I will hang around a
little longer.

For other members in Texas,=
 I'm in Houston, just across the channel
from the Golden Phoenix. I see we =
are well represented as a state. I
am glad to meet all of you.

Regards,
Jo=
n in Texas

> I have to admit that I thought I had seen the worst 'paranor=
mal'
show on television already. I was wrong. Door to the Dead has exceeded=

my worst expectations.
> =A0
> Generally, I respect John Oliver's work as =
a medium. While I have no
personal experience with him, in the past he has =
looked and acted more
genuine than not, the rolling of the eyes put aside f=
or the moment.
> =A0
> I do take exception to the characterization of the t=
alking box as an
Edison device. I have documented the history of Edison, IT=
C and
EVP=A0=A0elsewhere. This is however the smallest concern I have with =
this
show.
> =A0
> Prior to wathcing I had just had a conversation with a r=
espected
colleague on the West coast regarding interesting phenomena he and=

others are constantly observing in sites with phenomena similar to
that on=
 Door to the Dead. None of those measurements were made by this
team. The u=
se of thermal in this situation is not indicated as well.
> =A0
> The real =
concern is that no attempt was made to help this family in
a broader contex=
t. The skeptic did and said nothing skeptical as far
as I could tell. Key q=
uestions were not asked (at least on-camera)
that would reveal the psycho-d=
ynamics of this family. We know fairly
well at this time that PK phenomena =
is often centered on a focal
person who can exhibit specific characteristic=
s. That the team seems
unaware of this is quite disturbing to a person like=
 myself.
> =A0
> A real research opportunity was lost in this case, as was =
an
opportunity to educate the public on the right way to approach such
situ=
ations. Continually sending the messages that phenomena is based
on 'demons=
' and 'spirits' exclusively does nothing to further the
position of serious=
 investigators, which is perhaps most troubling of all.
>
